title.narrative: To save lives and reduce sufferings of flood affected individuals

description.narrative: This project is to respond to floods affected people in Mangala Payam of Juba County Central Equatoria State. Since July 2020, an estimated 1,034,000 people have been affected by floods and of those people affected, some 481,000 were estimated to have been displaced from their homes by the floods. People were affected in locations across Unity, Upper Nile, Warrap, Western Equatoria, Central Equatoria and Northern Bahr-el-Ghazal States. The urgent survival needs identified by IRNA include food and livelihood support, emergency shelter and non-food items (ES/NFI), and WASH, health, and protection services. Flood response activities are considerably constrained by persistent heavy rains, infrastructure damage and reduced physical accessibility (e.g., impassable roads, flooded airstrips), insecurity and limited resources. Core WaSH Pipeline has been reported depleted by IOM due to COVID 19. This caused difficulty to address urgent needs of flood affected people. The South Sudan Humanitarian Response Plan is funded at some 50 per cent of the total ask of US$1.9 billion, as of 18 November 2020. The total requirement for the current response was estimated at $81.9 million. More than $16 million has been mobilized from ECHO, DFID, and USAID in response to the floods and displacement.
